DG02.summary: This past full week, you have done slightly well at keeping your carbohydrate intake relatively fixed.
DG02.recommendation: Maintain a consistent level of carbohydrates throughout the day.
DG02.advice: To help maintain a relatively fixed carbohydrate intake, consider increasing your carbohydrate intake at dinner.
applies: You are on fixed insulin dosing.
source: ADA Dietary Guidelines, Chapter 5, Guideline 2: "Patients with Type 1 and Type 2 Diabetes on a constant level of insulin therapy are advised to maintain a consistent level of carbohydrates throughout the day."

DG05.summary: You have not been conforming to a high-carb, low-fat diet.
DG05.recommendation: Avoid following a high-carb, low-fat diet.
DG05.advice: Avoid following a high-carb, low-fat diet.
source: ADA Dietary Guidelines, Chapter 5, Guideline 5: "An eating plan emphasizing elements of a Mediterranean-style diet rich in monounsaturated and polyunsaturated fats may be considered to improve glucose metabolism and lower cardiovascular disease risk and can be an effective alternative to a diet low in total fat but relatively high in carbohydrates."

DG17.summary: On more than half of the days in the past month, you followed a low-carbohydrate eating plan.
source: ADA Dietary Guidelines, Chapter 5, Guideline 17: "For people with type 2 diabetes or prediabetes, low-carbohydrate eating plans show potential to improve glycemia and lipid outcomes for up to 1 year."
DG17.daily_advice: You should make sure to lower your carbohydrate intake.
DG17.advice_details: It is important to focus on following your low-carbohydrate plan.
